transcription: Philosophers question and clarify the most fundamental concepts and ideas that shape our lives. Through dialogue, philosophy teaches the capacity to recognize flawed reasoning and to appreciate and evaluate different points of view, both personal and cultural.  It helps you to engage critically with very difficult issues. It investigates questions that concern you personally and addresses the many challenges facing society today. Some of the questions you will think about in philosophy are what is right, just or true and what is not? How can we tell? Who has power over us and in turn  What power do we have? Can we ever know anything with certainty? Is there such a thing as freedom? What is a human being and what is a human mind? Why do we find some things useful, important, threatening or beautiful? What impact do differences in race, class, age, ability, privilege and education  What kind of life is worth living? The skills gained in philosophy are highly transferable and will serve you throughout your life, personally, professionally and socially. Critical thinking and clear writing have immediate practical applications in a range of professions, such as law, teaching, medicine, journalism, and the arts.  business and management, to name only a few. In recent years, employers have started to place greater emphasis on independent thought, critical thinking and innovation. A philosophical approach is now, perhaps more than ever, in high demand.  you
